intro: Claytonia chamissoi, commonly known as the Sierra violet, is a flowering plant native to the western United States. It belongs to the Portulacaceae family and is characterized by its rosette of fleshy, waxy leaves. The plant produces clusters of small, violet-colored flowers that bloom in spring. It thrives in rocky, well-drained soils and is often found in alpine and subalpine habitats. Claytonia chamissoi is adapted to cold climates and is an important species in its native ecosystem.
